utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: The math is all there. It’s not real.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes, it is.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah,uh, look, it is scientifically impossible for a person to tip a cow. Even you, with your stocky build and lumberjack shoulders, you couldn’t do it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s horrible. Why would you push a cow over? They’re sacred.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, stop it. I’ve seen you eat, like, a million hamburgers.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, an animal can be both sacred and delicious.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Look, I’m telling you I’ve done it, okay? I clearly remember the cow standing up and then the cow on its side.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Were you drunk?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I was 16 in Nebraska. What do you think?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I think you’re the one who fell over.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That would explain why the sky was also on its side.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Howard. Cow tipping. Real or not?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Mmm. I’m gonna say not. That’s just based on me trying to roll my mom over when she’s snoring. Speaking of that big side of beef, uh, she’s invited all of you to Thanksgiving at her house.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Mmm. You know, I’ve been told that a bald refusal of an invitation is rude and one must instead offer up a polite excuse, so I’d love to go, but, unfortunately, that sounds awful.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Come on, it’ll be fun.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, we were actually gonna do it here.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Please? Bernadette’s bringing her dad ’cause her mom’s out of town, and I never have anything to say to that guy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, since you put it that way, I’d love to go, but that sounds even more awful.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’d actually be nice to not hear Sheldon complain about my cooking all day.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Uh, excuse me, but every year you prepare a terrible meal and every year I criticize it. Do our traditions mean nothing to you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I want to go.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, me, too.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m in.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ugh, fine, I’ll go. But if her food is delicious, Thanksgiving is ruined, and it’s on you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Do we really have to go to Mrs. Wolowitz’s house?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: We do. And I expect you to be on your best behaviour.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Now I know how the African slaves felt. Being dragged from their homes to labour under the yoke of the white man.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Are you honestly comparing Thanksgiving dinner at Wolowitz’s mom’s with one of the greatest tragedies in the history of mankind?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, you can have a nice Thanksgiving anywhere. I spent one in Vegas.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You did?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, back when I was dating Zack. It was actually more fun than I thought. We gambled, we went to one of those cheesy wedding chapels, we had a really good turkey dinner. Which was surprising, since we were at a strip club.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wait, you went to a chapel?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: We had one of those silly fake weddings.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Penny, you know those are real, right?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, they’re not.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, they are.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, they’re not.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, they are.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: He’s right.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: They’re real.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: But it didn’t seem real.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Let me ask you a question. At any point, was Las Vegas on its side?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hi, Dad.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Hi, honey.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, you brought beer for everybody.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Uh, okay, yeah, it’s for everybody. I really just wanted to have a nice, quiet day at home and watch the game.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You can have a quiet day and watch the game here.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Howard, the medicine’s not working.

utterance.speaker: Howard (off)
utterance.content: You just took it. At least let it reach your first stomach. Hey, Mike. Let me help you out, there.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Thanks. What’s wrong with your mom?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, her gout’s flaring up. Turns out an apple pie a day does not keep the doctor away.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: How can one little toe hurt so bad?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Maybe because that little piggy is being crushed by the barn. She should quiet down soon. I gave her enough pain meds to choke a, well, her.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I guess we’re gonna have to do all the cooking.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I have a better idea.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: If you think you’re gonna make me do all this by myself, you’re crazy.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I was gonna make Raj do it all by himself.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, well, that’s a great idea.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No traffic, we’re sailing.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. Like we’re on a ship. Coming from Africa to America.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, that’s completely inappropriate. You can’t keep comparing yourself to a slave.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, Miss Amy.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I can’t believe you’re married to that idiot.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ugh, would you stop? We just did it as a goof.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, a goof or not, you’re actually married. You need to get this taken care of.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I will. Why are you making this such a big deal?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, oh, oh, I have a reason. It could be because you said yes to marrying Zack, but every time Leonard’s proposed, he’s gotten a resounding no. Yeah, that’s just off the top of my head.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So how do I undo this?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m hoping you can get an annulment. It’s just like it never happened.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Great, well, what do I have to do?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It says here you can get an annulment if any of the following conditions are met. Were you unable to consummate the marriage?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hah!Penny? Next.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Is there any evidence of fraud, bigamy, want of understanding?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Want of understanding? What does that even mean?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Ding, ding, ding. We have a winner.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Thanks for saving the day.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Ah, no problem. It wouldn’t be Thanksgiving without an Indian providing the food. Uh, now, where does your mom keep the Crisco?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Um, I don’t know. Probably in a wad in her cheek.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’ll help Raj in here. Why don’t you go keep my dad company?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: He doesn’t want me in there. I’m the creepy little guy who has sex with his daughter.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Don’t be silly, he loves you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Does he?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Okay, he cares about you a lot.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I do crap for you all the time. Get out there.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So your wife’s in Arizona with the grandkids?

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You know, my mom’s been to Arizona. She rode one of those mules down in the Grand Canyon. Long story short, they had to shoot it. ‘Cause she’s so fat. I’ll get the door while you finish laughing. Hey, guys.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Happy Thanksgiving.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It smells wonderful. Is anyone slaving away in the kitchen? Because I, too, know…

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Here. Thank you for having us.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What’s with you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, she’s mad at me because she just found out she’s married to Zack.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Really? That dumb-ass she used to date? That’s hysterical.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I can’t believe I felt bad for opening this in the car.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You need any help?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Uh, yeah, can you, uh, reach that, uh, gravy boat up there?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Uh, sure.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Great. That makes one of you. Okay, we have a lot to do and not much time to do it. Bernadette, you’re on corn, gravy and yam detail. Amy, you’re on rolls, cranberries and making sure Bernadette stays away from the marshmallows. That’s right, I see you. Okay, if you have any questions, I’ll be over here basting my ass off. Focus is key.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Did you guys know Penny married Zack three years ago?

utterance.speaker: Together
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You ever play football?

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: A little in college. You?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No. But I did get tackled in the hallway once. The whole school cheered.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, I found the, uh, court papers that you and Zack need to fill out. I’ll print them when we get home.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And we can just put this whole thing behind us.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Are you done?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Look, I get it, I screwed up. Is this all we’re gonna talk about the rest of the day?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why are you mad at me? You’re the one that did the stupid thing. I’m just trying to fix it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ugh, I need some air.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wuh, Penny.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t know the first thing about women, but I would not follow her.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Listen to Stretch.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How am I the bad guy? She’s the one who married someone else. I’m the victim.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sounds like Zack’s the victim. You’re sleeping with his wife.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: I’ve kept my marriage together for 35 years. Can I weigh in here?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: I’m trying to watch the game. Shut up. Oh, how do you not make a first down there?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: They passed against a nickel defence. They should have run it off-tackle.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: How the hell do you know that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: My father loved football. He always made me watch it before I was allowed to do my homework.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, you’ll be happy to know I just spoke to Zack and he’s willing to sign the court papers. He’s on his way here now.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wait, you invited him here?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: I’m getting ready to weigh in again.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Come on.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: What do you think they ought to do now?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I would throw a quick slant to a wideout, given that the defence is showing blitz.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, I love a good blitz, especially with sour cream. Get it? ‘Cause it sounds like blintz.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Did someone say blintz?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I just don’t understand why you invited him here today.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Because you wouldn’t shut up about it. When I called him, he had nothing to do, so I just thought it would…

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, guys, I’m trying to cook in here.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, sorry. We’ll keep it down.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, no, speak up. I’m about to use the blender, and I don’t want to miss anything.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, you might have to cook for one more because she invited Zack.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Ooh!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: My, my. The plot, like my gravy, thickens.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t care for your mother’s bathroom. There’s not an angle to do one’s business without a clown figurine staring at you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s why I sit.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s why. You remember the Thanksgiving game when it snowed in Dallas?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: 1993. Leon Lett blew the game in the final seconds and the Dolphins emerged victorious. Then I finally got to do my calculus.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: I was so pissed, I wanted to shoot my TV.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So was my dad. And then he did.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Anyone need a beer?

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Thank God.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: So, does your dad still live in Texas?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. He died when I was 14.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: I’m sorry to hear that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So was the man who owned the local liquor store. He cried and cried.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Here you go.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Oh, thanks. So, if your dad died when you were 14, you were never old enough to have a beer with the man.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, sir. He did try to give me one for my high school graduation, but I was 11 and my mom said no.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Well, you’re having one with me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: To your dad.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I never had a beer with my dad, either.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Do you mind? We’re having a moment here.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I can’t believe Penny’s married to Zack.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Wonder what she saw in that guy.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I don’t know. He’s sweet, he’s tall, handsome.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Broad shoulders, good hair.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hmm. Wonder what she sees in Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: How’s it going out there?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sheldon and your dad are bonding and completely ignoring me.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I know how you feel. Sheldon ignored me for a week when he got that Roomba vacuum. I kick it when he’s not looking.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What are they doing?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: They’re drinking beer and watching football.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: So why don’t you do that with them?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: They don’t want me.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, Sheldon started talking about how his dad isn’t alive any more, and they were toasting, and I tried to tell them about how sad I was when my dad abandoned…

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Zack’s here!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Stir the gravy.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Sorry. I really want to hear how sad you are. I’ll be back in like five, ten minutes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sorry she made you come over here on a holiday.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: It’s all right. I didn’t have anything going on. Plus, Penny told me we’re married, and Thanksgiving’s a time to be with family.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, okay, great. Can we just get this over with?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, uh, you guys have to sign here and here. On Monday, we’ll file for the annulment, and this marriage will be over.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: I don’t know if I want to sign it.

utterance.speaker: Raj, Bernadette and Amy
utterance.content: Ooh.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why won’t you sign it?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: I just think splitting up can be rough on kids.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: We don’t have any kids.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Are you sure? ‘Cause you didn’t know we were married until this morning.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, look, Zack, come on. You know neither of us thought this was real. I mean, we were married by an Elvis impersonator.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Of course it was an impersonator. We could never afford a real Elvis.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You married him instead of me? Good call. Sign the papers.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hang on. You know what? You have been a jerk about this all day. You always do this, whenever I mess up, you’re right there to make me feel even worse about it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That is not true.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, we could’ve waited till Monday, signed the papers, this all would have been over.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re the one who invited him here.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, there you go again, just another mistake you’re throwing in my face.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Not cool, bro. I’m starting to think you’re not the kind of guy I want dating my wife.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, well, she’s not gonna be your wife for long.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Oh, no. Are you dying?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m about to. Sign the paper.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Know what they say, happy wife, happy life. Let’s eat.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (burping)
utterance.content: Two, three, eight, four, six. That’s all I can do without throwing up.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: That is not what I expected when you said you were gonna burp pie.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Did somebody say pie?

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: I don’t know what’s scarier, the bathroom clowns or the woman that put them there.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All I know is you can only fit one of her in a car. And there’s the clown that came out of her. I really didn’t want to come here, but this is shaping up to be one of the best Thanksgivings I’ve had in a long time.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Me, too.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hey. Howie says you’ve been making fun of him all day. Now, both of you apologize right now.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: She’s so tiny. It’s funny when she’s mad.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: All right, mister, I think you owe Howard and Bernadette an apology.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Perhaps you’re right. I’m sorry for my behaviour. I’ve had alcohol, and it’s caused me to be inappropriate.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: It’s okay.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Don’t worry about it.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ain’t she great?

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Now, how’s about you get us a couple of beers?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Thanks again for cooking.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yeah, everything was delicious.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, I couldn’t have done it without my two favourite girls. Martha Stewart and Rachael Ray.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Hey, Sheldon, what do you say we go outside and throw around the old pigskin?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This is a Jewish house. I don’t think they have pigskin.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Did someone say pigskin?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, I’m sorry about today. And I promise, next time I get married, it won’t be a joke. It’ll be for love. Or money.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m sorry, too.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Don’t be. It’s my fault. I was a terrible husband. I was never around.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: I know I’m hard on you, but you’re not the worst son-in-law in the world.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Mike, that’s the nicest thing you’ve ever said to me.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Well, I’m drunk.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I just vomited on a lot of clowns.
